name: Iberostar Paraiso Maya

reviews.text: I have traveled the Caribbean extensively and most often book my vacations through Apple. I always book a "Six Golden Apples" (the highest rating possible with Apple Vacations) and I have found their ratings to be trustworthy and valid. NOT so on this trip to this property. There was no welcome at the reception desk, in fact there is no real reception desk just staff meembers sitting behind a table. The rooms were dirty, scrungy bathrooms, ( I have pictures to prove it) ants crawling around the coffee maker area, dirty dishes left all over the property at all times of theday and night and the food was less than satisfactory. There was scrunge all around the swimming pool and black rings around the steps .Two nights out of five, we had no water to take showers when we returned from the beach. As an apology, a cheap bottle (with no label) of champagne was delievered to our room each night . On the last day, I had complained so much the front desk called to offer us an an "all inclusive bracelet" so we could hang out at the Iberostar Grand, next door. What ????
reviews.title: Uggggh

reviews.text: If I had paid for a cheap hotel, I would have expected this but to pay for a six golden apple property and to have this treatment was totally unfair. Never again.
reviews.title: Excellent Beautiful Fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This resort is beautiful, impeccably maintained, and a perfect vacation spot for a family. Although it is HUGE - when you consider all 4 resorts (Del Mar, Beach, Lindo and Maya), when you get to know the paths, there are shortcuts everywhere. Also, it makes for nice walks. I enjoyed exploring around, and checking out the other pool areas and grounds - all were beautiful (I can see how it is too spread out for older guests, although there is a trolley available). FYI, there is free wifi in the lobby. I can't imagine anyone not loving this place!!
reviews.title: Great Winter Escape

reviews.text: Rooms - Very large - I would have liked a little more light. The lowest temperature they allow is 20.5 celcius. We thought the beds were comfortable.
reviews.title: Awesome Resort!!!

reviews.text: Grounds - Absolutely gorgeous! The staff cleans, polishes, scrubs all day long, so the resort is spotless. The resort is spectacular.
reviews.title: Too big but the kids loved it

reviews.text: We took our adult children and 20 month old granddaughter for five days to Paraiso Maya to celebrate my husband's 60th birthday. I had read many reviews about the pros and cons, we had all pros! Check in was easy and quick, The resort is very large and it did take us a day to get acclamated. The breakfast and lunch buffets were very adequate, we ate dinners at the ala carte restaurants and we had no complaints. My boys were very pleased with the unlimited alcohol and soft drinks. Yes, the beds were hard, we asked for mattress pads and that worked just fine. The service was wonderful, everything we needed was there with no hassels. Every 2 buildings had it's own conceirge, which was very convenient, they were there all day until 8 pm, and helped with anything and everything. The gardens were well kept, no trash around, someone was cleaning the resort all day and night long. The beach was close to our room, as was the pool, this was very convenient. The mini suites were large, and all the rooms had "jungle" type views, which I didn't mind. The main complaint was that the pool was cold, but we had been there right after December rains. I highly recommend this location for families, for an adults only romantic vacation, I'd suggest The Grand, next door. We walked over there and that was just amazingly beautiful.
reviews.title: Wonderful vacation, good times was had by all!!

reviews.text: We were there Jan 24-28th until Gerardo (the fantastic apple rep) transfered us to dreams riviera. My son and husband were very sick days 2-4. This was our 5th time to Mexico, and first time sick. REALLY SICK! I suspect food poisoning, possibly from beach hamburgers. I know this can happen anywhere, but do think it's more likely if you are eating buffet food, or food that has been sitting out a while (as opposed to the ala- carte service at dreams.) We had not yet had sun, or swam in ocean, so those culprits were ruled out.
reviews.title: Stay at dreams.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Aside from being sick, the lower level rooms are musty smelling, It really takes a while to find your way around, (It was especially hard for my 70 yr. old mom) and the whole reservation system for dinners is a pain. Another reviewer said it perfectly "There is no easy button".
reviews.title: 3 years later, still superb!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked here thinking it would be more fun for our 11 yr. old since they advertise many activities. However, they were really lame. Even the wave pool was for a younger set. We didn't see anyone use the Lazy River, ping pong was in a dark corner where the ledge the table sat on was not large enough, pools were very cold, no hot tubs, long path to beach. Same music blairing every day etc. etc.. If you do like this sort of resort, I could not see any reason to pay extra for the Maya. Might as well stay at the Lindo.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Days 4-7 at dreams was much better. As the rep there said, Iberostars are an older more old fashion resort chain. Dreams is a much newer, hipper way to stay. No wrist bands, eat where you want when you want, and almost all rooms have an ocean view. (They are smaller, but nicer) I even felt the neutral color scheme of the resort was more relaxing and less dated. A new employees at Iberostar was even complaining about his purple pants.
reviews.title: well looked after on 3rd visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been to a total of 6 All-Inclusive resorts in the Dominican and Mexico and this one rates at the top. Our most recent an comparable trip to the Mayan Riviera was to the Barcelo Palace and we would recommend this resort over the Barcelo by far.
reviews.title: Amazing Time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms: Junior Suite - Good Size, A little dated in the bathroom, Beds a little hard but didnt bother us. We would rank this part as a 4.5* hotel
reviews.title: Awesome Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Grounds: Emaculate! We never saw errant cups or garbage. There were ALWAYS people out cleaning and grooming. The amount of greenery and wildlife was amazing. Deffinitly a 5*
reviews.title: Think Twice about this place

reviews.text: Pools: The pools were very clean and great that they are salt water. The Del Mar and Beach pool was just as nice as the Lindo and Maya pool. We expected better loungers and the little "bed" style covered areas so we disapointed that they had some at the Del Mar and Beach and not at ours. Ranking about a 4.5*
reviews.title: Best vacation we have ever had

reviews.text: Food: You wont go hungry at all. If you are fussy about food try to keep an open mind but the seafood is always a good choice. Buffets were great for selection but temperatures were tepid at best.The a la cartes were as follows:
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Location

reviews.text: We recently spent a week at the Iberostar Maya during the second week of February. This was our first visit to an Iberostar resort and we were fairly impressed with the level of customer service at the resort. Prior to our trip I sent the resort an email request for a room location and received a response within 10 minutes.
reviews.title: Very pleased!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We travelled with Air Transat and upon arrival in Cancun were immediately directed to a small van which took us to the hotel. The trip to the hotel took no more than 30 minutes.
reviews.title: Iberostar Maya...Very nice stay , 2/19-1/26

reviews.text: We were greeted at the reception in the Maya lobby and given a quick overview of the resort. The gentleman who checked us in referred to my email requests and they were met. Our room was ready right away which was nice. We were taken to our room by the bell boy and were unpacking by 11:30am. There is a concierge in each building who will assist with any issues and book the a-la-cartes for you.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was fairly big, the rooms are a little bit darker than I would prefer but extremely clean. There is no need to use the room key card to activate the lights or air conditioning. There are small sensors in the room which activate the lights and air conditioning. The room was equipped with a safe, coffee maker, umbrella, iron and ironing board and hair dryer. There were always extra towels in the room and the maid service was very good, we also received nightly turn down service. The fridge was always stocked with pop, beer and water.
reviews.title: Iberostar - brilliant once again!

reviews.text: The pool at the resort was rather cool during our stay but it provided a refreshing break from the heat. There were tons and I mean tons of palpas and loungers around the pool. In fact I think there are too many which is certainly not common for a resort. If you sat on the Maya side of the pool you were in complete shade by about 2pm. Most people crammed around the pool on the Lindo side. The lazy river was a nice relaxing break and really did not appear to get much use. The wave pool was popular with the kids and a few adults. There are 3 small pools exclusive to Maya guests next to buildings 66, 63 and 60. My complaint about these pools are that the lounge chairs at these pools are different than the loungers found at the regular pools or on the beach. They are so uncomfortable. If the resort fixed this I think that people would sit there. We only saw 1 couple sitting beside the small pool at building 60 once during our stay. The rest of the time nobody was there.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, average food, horrible agency

aka: Iberostar Paraiso Maya Hotel Playa Paraiso
description: Located directly on the beautiful beach ofPlaya Paraiso" (Mexico). All junior suites with Jacuzzi, DVD player, upgraded amenities. Exclusive dining plus dine around privileges at over 16 restaurants, 17 full service bars.
